website_summaries.verdict: This budget model is worth considering if you don't need a heavy-duty floor fan. A low-end model from a respected manufacturer.
pros: Has everything consumers who don't want to spend a lot of money are looking for in a fan: an easy-to-move 15-inch model with 3 versatile speeds and quiet yet reasonable air output
We love its removable grill that is easy to take off when it's time to clean the blades
cons: It doesn't have comparable airflow to larger, costlier models, but if price is your top concern, you may not mind

website_summaries.verdict: Multiple size options to find the right fan for your cooling needs. Ability to mount to the wall for extra convenience and positioning.
pros: We love how the larger fan blades produce a more focused and stronger stream of air
Minimal energy usage even at high settings
cons: Base on a table doesn’t provide the same amount of stability as larger mounting options

customer_reviews.title: Dying after 5 months.
customer_reviews.text: 5 Months old and this motor is already dying. It runs at about 50% of the speed it should, unless I aim it down, then it blows faster. 1 Year warranty? Yea, but you have to pay $10 in shipping, whats the point? Guess I'll buy another one at $8 and hope is doesn't die in another 5 months. I had one of these fans 5 or so years ago and it worked great for years. Maybe they are making them cheaper now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Unstable, but cool air
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 when our box fan finally gave into old age. At first, both crazy quiet with just the right amount of white noise. The air movement was amazing, cool and you can feel it across the room. But, 1 week into it and 1 fan just stopped working. Turned it off the morning, went to turn it on in the evening, and bam nothing. Changed the fuse and again, nothing. About 5 days or so later, same thing. One I can see, maybe just a bad fan, it happens. Two??? Ugh So while it's great, it's very unstable, and didn't last us long at all. I can't recommend this
customer_reviews.author: kid

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed It Broke In Less Than 90 Days!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fan was working fine the first month I had it then it started to squeak badly. The squeaking would come and go periodically and it got worse before it finally completely died. Disappointed because I need it to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: These used to be great fans...here is how you can tell
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these in 2019...great fans! Purchased another one Feb-2020 and noticed it was and pumping out less air. Checking the sticker on bottom of fan it said: 120Volts 0.25Amps. My old fans had sticker: 120Volts 0.6Amps. So they cut cost on the new fans put a motor in that is less than half as powerful! I purchased the next model up, Honeywell HT908, which gets me much better airflow(its sticker read 120Volts 0.5Amps). The only other fan to compete with the HT908 is the AmazonBasics fan which lists a power consumption of 55Watts. Since the HT908 uses 60Watts(120 * 0.5) you should expect it to be pushing more air. In general more Amps(and consequently Watts) means more airflow.
customer_reviews.author: electron.boy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fan with a single glaring con,for those young at heart
customer_reviews.text: let me start off by saying this: Before this fan I was sweating enough to get us out of the California drought. With this fan now I am cool as a cucumber I have not drippity drop dropped a single sweat in my room ever since I plopped this puppy on my desk. BUT..I cannot talk into the fan and distort my voice which really let down my inner 6 year old self. Still 5 stars, but for those of you looking to distort your voice by speaking into your new beloved table fan, look elsewhere. If the above doesn't apply to you stop reading this nonsense and buy the thing already!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one to break in 4 months, Honeywell never responded to my emails
customer_reviews.text: We've purchased Honeywell fans for a while now, especially the small models. My kids like them to sleep with and my husbands uses the larger models at his business. 4 months ago, I bought a new smaller model after one of the other ones dies. After 2 weeks, it died. I replaced it because I didn't want to bother returning it. 4 months later we purchased another. It died 2 DAYS after we purchased it. It is MY personal fan...not my kid's. I wrote the company at Honeywell. No response. I will never, ever purchase a Honeywell fan again. Poorly made products, don't return messages, poor customer service.
customer_reviews.author: RNPacker.Mom

customer_reviews.title: Really as  good as the original, for me anyway. Less of a buzz fan thougb.
customer_reviews.text: My first impression must be very common. The fan is now more light and does indeed tend to fall over.... however I noticed it now sits more like a large turbo fan with the "base" as a support. One nail in the wall and I can stick it up there, no problem. The energy and sound level being real things I like this fan. The affordable price certainly helps....in the picture it is hanging on one nail that was in the wall already painted white.
customer_reviews.author: william landreth

customer_reviews.title: Weaker Motor Than Older Model
customer_reviews.text: We had several of this same kind of fan for years and loved them. Bought replacement when they died after 12-15 years and they are now very weak in terms of blowing air. Also a lot quieter (due to weaker motor) but we liked them for white noise. The new version is quieter on “high” than the old version was on “low.” And again, not much air circulation at all.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta G.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little thing.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small fan for my guest room and I didn’t want to pay much for it so I found this little fella which is very handy to have around since my A/C it is not so powerful in that room, now the cold air flows better and it maintains the room fresh just what I was looking for. The noise is very imperceptible white noise basically, three different levels of power and they are very decent specially if you see the size of the fan pretty happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jose linares

customer_reviews.title: Just go to Target
customer_reviews.text: I bought this same fan at Target and loved it. Small but mighty with great air flow. I needed another one a month later so decided to buy on Amazon. Same model but NOT the same fan. The one on here is very weak. I almost believe it’s a counterfeit. Just do target drive up.
customer_reviews.author: Audraevee

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Okay so I was looking for a little fan to accompany my air conditioner that would sit by my bed. I have asthma and have been having hot flashes. This fan barely blows. Because it is so quiet you wonder if it’s even on. But when you place your face or hand in front of it you can feel a very slight breeze. Horrible!!!! I know and like this brand but no no no not this.
customer_reviews.author: NYToy

customer_reviews.title: Trinidadians and Tobago'nites love this here fan my friends!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Trinidad and this is the first time I have able to love life again here in the second hottest spot on earth (the hottest being Tabago, of course.) If you live in a tropical environment, then buy this fan...you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: @pickerofcrabapples

customer_reviews.title: I love this fan for the price and purpose
customer_reviews.text: I love this fan for the price and purpose. However, after a few months of use it's gotten progressively louder when it's on. Going to keep it for occasional use, but will need to get a new one for use when we are sleeping.... Update: After three months the fan started to change speeds randomly on the lowest setting. After two weeks it stopped working totally. I guess you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Lady J

customer_reviews.title: Fan is off balance, makes annoying noise.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first one 15 years ago. It was thicker plastic, very solid, but loud. This would be my second one and the plastic is thinner and lighter, feels almost flimsy, and slightly quieter. What makes this bad though is that it's off balance somewhere, so there's this back and forth burring sound that's different then the normal consist buzzing. Since I only paid $10, it's probably worth that (or less). I use it mainly to push solvent fumes when I clean machinery, so I guess I'll keep it. I otherwise would not use this for personal comfort use.
customer_reviews.author: dsfa

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after less than 1 month
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a tiny desk fan at work. I got this in the mail and realized I didn't read the dimensions and was bummed. I planned to return it. I'm so glad I didn't. Instead I took it home and left it near my bed. This tiny fan is mighty but quiet. It has several settings. This fan was super inexpensive. I'm sure happy I did not return this fan. If this thing ever dies, which I doubt it will, I plan to repurchase another! Update: fan stopped working after less than 1 month. :( Guess the reviews are true!
customer_reviews.author: Macy

customer_reviews.title: It's a good fan for the price, but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: It's an okay fan, it works reliably, and it can crank some pretty decent airflow. However, there's a dull hum that comes and goes with the Honeywell HT-900, which overrides the white noise effect of the fan. I had to move it to the carpeted floor to reduce the effect of this noise, which in turn reduces the effectiveness of the fan. Inexpensive fans like this will always do this, I think. It's not a bad product, it's just priced at a certain low price point and it was manufactured accordingly. A decent but flawed fan at a cheap price – that's what you're getting.
customer_reviews.author: Evrock44

customer_reviews.title: Not very effective as a fan, much better as a hood ornament
customer_reviews.text: This fan looks nice, and easy to set up, makes little noise etc - all great features except it doesn't do much of what a fan is supposed to do - and that is move the air or blow a nice breeze. I thought Honeywell was a well known brand - but I guess their glory has faded. I can't recommend this product - try something that costs more (this was under $30). With so many of us sheltering in place due to the Covid/19-Corona Virus -and money being tight - fans will be selling like hotcakes this year, I just recommend you don't buy this brand. Sorry, but that's how I rate it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: My son has this same fan that was my dads so it is a good 10 years old and still works great so I bought one. I’ve had it exactly 3 weeks and it just stopped working last night. It also didn’t work anywhere near how our older one does. I am getting a replacement so I will change my review if this one was just a dud. Update: I did receive a new fan very fast and so far so good. I think the last fan was a just a dud. We will see in a few weeks. This one is louder, not in a bad way, the one that broke was oddly quiet and not very strong.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Turboforce shouldn't be it's name
customer_reviews.text: I had very high expectations as I owned the same fan during my University years. Honeywell have dropped quality very bad! The fan at high setting pushes less air than the low setting in the the previous model. Now I understand why it's energy efficient... It barely uses energy as it does not pushes air! The plastic material of construction does not feels sturdy at all. It's like Honeywell contracted Wish to manufacture their new model. I'm surprised about how bad the performance is in this model. As a comparison, it pushes about the same air as a good USB fan. Honeywell should drop the Turboforce name as it confuses the buyer. They should sell it as personal office fan.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Smells awful
customer_reviews.text: The look of the fan is nice, nice size, small and powerful, however, after over 3 months of trying to get rid of an unpleasant smell that comes from this fan (I bought two of them), I gave up and ordered two other non-Honeywell fans. I simply can no longer handle the smell. I gave both fans more then enough time to "break them in" from any odd smell that sometimes new products have. Since I don't think I qualify for a refund, both these fans will be donated ASAP. Someone will get a good fan that stinks!! (sorry about that!)
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Total disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I initially gave this fan 4 stars after buying it last year with this original review: I've been using these fans for years and just bought one for my baby's room. I have just one strange complaint--they have made it "25% quieter," but I have always loved these fans for white noise. Wish it was noisier again! I've had to lower to one star now as the fan died after 10 months of use. Total disappointment considering the one I bought years ago is still going strong. In making it 25% quieter, they've made it weaker and, apparently, lowered its lifespan. Don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: cookiedough

customer_reviews.title: Barely Working After 6 Months - Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this fan for 6 months. To get it started now, I have to turn the switch to on, then stick something narrow between the grill give the fan blades a little nudge to get going. It then works until I turn it off again. It also just makes a loud rattling noise all the time now. I contacted Honeywell. They said they don't make the product. It is manufactured by another company who licenses the Honeywell name. That company charges a $10 shipping fee for the fan even though it is under warranty. That's a bad use of your name Honeywell. Don't buy this fan!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: It's ok but low air. Electrical burning smell on first use
customer_reviews.text: As others have said the air output is low. Luckily I got this for my small, matchbox bathroom so it's in close proximity but I still would have liked a stronger output. Also this had a scary burning electrical smell when I first turned it on but it eventually went away after leaving it on for 10 minutes. Not really happy with it and expected better coming from Honeywell but it's going to be slightly used anyway so not worth the effort of returning
customer_reviews.author: Ravyn

customer_reviews.title: There were two in the pack?! yaaaas
customer_reviews.text: Hey, I thought I was paying $15 for 1 fan but I clearly misread the description. I'm happy enough with my purchase of what it can do. It's no Vornado, but if you're strapped for cash like me, it definitely suffices. And then when I got the box there were TWO fans- and then I reread the description and I'm like even happier. If I went to the store you know I would have probably paid something like $24.99 for one. EVEN if it's just one fan, $15 is absolutely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Great for my office desk.
customer_reviews.text: Certainly pushes a lot of air for the size. It is slightly larger than my desk phone, so doesn't take up too much space on my desk. It is also whisper quiet. I have seen smaller fans, and quieter fans, but not ones as small and quiet with as much strength as this one. In the small space of my cubical, anything above the lowest setting is too strong, though. So would likely work as well or better in a larger office.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: I should’ve returned it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this June 9th and it’s not working anymore. I’ve had it in the same spot since I plugged it in and hasn’t been dropped or anything and all of a sudden it just didn’t want to turn on anymore. Of course, it’s past the return date so now I’m gonna have to buy a new one. I wanted something smaller but decided to try it out.... I should’ve just returned it like I was going to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Box arrived damaged and the fan was broken.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product I bought one at a store the same exact one in white so I decided to buy this one on Amazon in Black. I'm giving it 5 Stars only because I already had one. This one arrived in a damaged box and unfortunately the fan was broken. I know it's not the manufacturer's fault that's why I gave it five stars but I am still very disappointed because I did not get to put it to use.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Nothing close to Honeywell
customer_reviews.text: These are awful! No power whatsoever. If you put it directly on you it’s feels like one of those battery operated hand held fans. If that’s what your looking for then this is perfect. I purchased the same size Honeywell fan a few years ago and that van felt like a full size unit. This is nothing close to that. Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Does not provide turbo or enough to even have.
customer_reviews.text: This is suppose to be a turbo fan and it hardly puts out any air even on high. I have a very small room and it hardly can be felt.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little fan!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a nice, sturdy fan to cool you off during those hot summer days, look no more! With 3 different speeds, this fan produces wind that can be felt at least 6 feet away!! It would also work really well for those looking for that "white noise" sound while you are sleeping. I also like the fact that it is mountable!! The fan itself is made of a hard, sturdy plastic that will last for years to come! If I were to say anything negative, it would be that the cord is a little on the short side. All in all, you won't be disappointed with this heavy duty little fan!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!! I highly recommend this fan!!
customer_reviews.text: Great lil fan with the power of a larger fan. These work very well, theyre adjustable, also have 3 settings, and are the perfect size! I ended up purchasing 3 in total for our bedrooms, or other rooms when needed, and barely even use the air conditioning anymore. I recommend these to everyone I know, and those who have seen it in action, are very impressed with how effective it really is! These are not silent fans, but it does make less of the typical fan sound than most on the market. Definitely a no regret purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: T.rok

customer_reviews.title: Great Fan!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this little fan. I've purchased several others that were supposedly quiet fans, but this one really is! The others that I've purchased were metal, which I thought would hold up better, but the cage rattles. I guess because this one is plastic it's quieter, which I'm very happy with! We keep it in the bedroom and moves enough air along with our ceiling fan to keep us cool. *****UPDATE***** Had to send the fan back!! It crapped out after just 1 week :(
customer_reviews.author: Kathy A.

customer_reviews.title: My Go-To
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this exact fan for years. The last one lasted almost four years and I just recently had to replace it as the motor started dying. I use it just as a little air flow and white noise while I sleep. For the price point, I really don’t mind replacing this every few years. I will say that this newest one I bought, the fastest speed is a little slower/quieter than my last one. I love this fan.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kidd

customer_reviews.title: Useful Product.
customer_reviews.text: Used it now for 10 days. Small Unobtrusive Unit. Noise is acceptable -- I only use it at its lowest setting from about 10 feet away -- very effective airflow, I don't need no hurricane -- better than the very popular but useless vertical Cylindrical fans. What I don't like about it is the SPEED SELECTOR knob. You always have to go through level III, then Level II and finally to Level I, to get to the lowest speed. I would have preferred that it goes in the opposite sequence, i.e starting at the lowest speed and then going higher [see photograph]
customer_reviews.author: ICU-YJM

customer_reviews.title: Very QUIET! Great for room circulation.
customer_reviews.text: Son is super picky about fans because they cannot make any noise, we've already gone through a handful because they are too "noisy". Bu he loves this one. Its pretty quiet and great for just circulated the air around the room. He games alot which creates more heat in bedroom and this fan is going 24/7. Love it! Works great for his small enclosed room.
customer_reviews.author: justabusymom

customer_reviews.title: Works even in the dark
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this baby for very long, but I plugged it in 12 hours ago and he's still going strong. It's a black fan, but it works during both the day and the night, although it does not glow in the dark. He doesn't make very much noise on the lowest setting, but on the highest setting this black fan makes enough white noise for me to be able to hear things that aren't there. It might be a good EMF detector if you decide to go ghost hunting, but you would need to bring a hand held generator or something in order to power this robot
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: I know
customer_reviews.text: I got distracted for hours trying to find the best little fan. I like underdog products, but I gave in and bought the darling budget fan of the review blogs. It's not silent like a bladeless fan, but it's quiet and I can feel the breeze on the other side of the room. I was planning on buying a bigger fan too, but I think I would rather have three or four of these hidden around my place. -I'm a real person who is writing this review after waking up from binging 30Rock episodes on Hulu.
customer_reviews.author: Macoroni Fan

customer_reviews.title: For one person only
customer_reviews.text: This is a quiet fan. I don't use a fan for white sleeping noise, so I don't know if it would work for that. It is OK for one person. I have been running it at the highest of three speeds at about six feet away from me. I don't think it would help cool a small room. I certainly don't think it could be felt the 27 feet that the listing claims. It is lightweight and comes out of the box ready to go. The angle of the fan is easy to adjust and it clicks into place. I wish it moved more air. It was an affordable, stable option.
customer_reviews.author: Boo Radley 007

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet. Lower two speeds are very low airflow.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great fan But,,, I was replacing an old HT-800 and was disappointed that this fan on high speed barely meets the old HT800 on low. They’re the same size so not sure why the slowdown. I use it for air movement and more importantly the white noise so the new 900 series won’t cut it for me. But if you want quiet air movement these are great.
customer_reviews.author: toomanyhobbies

customer_reviews.title: Worked okay, but died after less than 5 min of use
customer_reviews.text: Tl;dr: Hard pass on this one. I bought this fan a few months ago and left in its box until summer rolled around. When I finally removed it from the the packaging and turned it on the first thing I noticed was that the air flow - even on the highest setting, was low. Nonetheless, I ran the can for just under 5 min before it stopped dead. After check the fuse and finding it perfectly fine, I am left with no idea why it just stopped. It's too bad, because my previous Honeywell (seemingly the exact same model) lasted for nearly 20 years before it finally died.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 months of use
customer_reviews.text: Update: after using the fan for two months it just died. I replaced the fuse with no luck. Stick with another brand as this one died in 2 months when my others lasted 2 years. Old post: I like a fan I can sleep with at night that wipes out the sound. If you want a quieter fan, this is the one for you. However, if you want a fan that is loud enough to block the birds chirping on weekends outside your window...this is not the fan for you. I will be looking for another similar to my Holmes fan I had before.
customer_reviews.author: StopherB

customer_reviews.title: The CFM is not 350 as the Honeywell site states. Same air speed as the 904 model
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my aging Honeywell 904 model , which puts out approx 150+ CFM . the Honeywell site says that this model CFM rating is 350. The fan IS quite & more energy efficient, BUT it is not as powerful as the CFM rating would have you believe. It's pretty much puts out the same or less than the 904. Disappointing.The last Honeywell fan lasted me 2+ years of use being on all night, so I feel favorably about the brand & it's one of the only fans that fits in the window I put it in, so for now, it's my best option,but buy the 904 model if you don't care about energy efficiency
customer_reviews.author: BookshireCrone

customer_reviews.title: Super weak
customer_reviews.text: Feel it from 25' away? Not likely. The fan is weak. I put it on high when I first got it and thought it was actually on the lowest setting.
customer_reviews.author: Jota

customer_reviews.title: Great fan for great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan two years ago for my oldest son (6 at the time) who was in the top bunk and sweating every night. My one frustration at the time was that the movements of the fan were limited. It didn't rotate left to right at all, but more importantly, the up/down rotation was very limited. Still, two years later he uses it regularly and I came back today to buy another - now for the newest inhabitant of the sweltering top bunk. You can't beat the price (which is cheaper than at that big name chain store in nearly every town) and it works great for what we need.
customer_reviews.author: Kath

customer_reviews.title: Low frequency white noise.  Almost a helicopter thump to it.
customer_reviews.text: The fan is setting on the dresser in front of the bed and moves enough air on low to get the job done. The sound is pretty low with a barely audible helicopter blade thump. The life flight chopper's final approach to the hospital is directly in line with my street so I've gotten some good comparisons. It's so close that I'll wake up in the middle of the night wonder if I'm hearing the air ambulance or the ghetto bird. No complaints, just wanted to mention it. For the price? Get it.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This fan is pretty weak compared to a vornado of the same size. The vornado costs more, but I think it's worth it. Plus, it doesn't work in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't point downward
customer_reviews.text: I got this small fan because I wanted it to sit on top of my tall dressers. I figured since it can rotate it would be able to point downwards towards the bed. Unfortunately this is not the case it either points outward and any range to point upward. I think the is a silly feature because I can't think of a reason to have my fan pointing at the ceiling but that can be just me. Either way I do like the output from this fan and I enjoy the fact it is small, quiet, and blows well but I don't understand the range of motion it has.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME fan, lasts forever
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this fan! I actually bought this one to replace one that has finally died after 5 years. I bought this fan for my freshman year of college at Bed, Bath & Beyond, and it lasted this long. Unfortunately, one day it just stopped working. I keep my fans on at ALL times, every day, so for the fan to work for that long is amazing. I get extremely hot at night and I love being as cold as possible, this little fan blows air miles away, and is cool. I will keep continuing to purchase this fan as long as I can.
customer_reviews.author: Georgina Smith

customer_reviews.title: Decent portable fan
customer_reviews.text: I liked Honeywell Air Circulator Fan. I have been using it regularly without any issues. It offers speed control knobs that help to adjust the air flow. It is made of plastics and hence it is very light weight. I can move it easily from my study room to dinning room easily. It offers decent amount of air flow. Cons: Noise level is little high when it runs at the highest speed. But I keep it at the medium speed when I need to reduce its noise. It does not rotate in all direction meaning you can get air in a particular direction. Overall, I am happy with this basic air fan.
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: Average, nothing special.
customer_reviews.text: Some of the advertising suggests that you're getting a mini, controlled hurricane in a plastic frame. Nope, it's just a fan. This is just a little larger than a desk fan. I've only tried it on the first two speeds, and the results were blah. It does what it says, it moves the air. I doubt that the third speed is that much more impressive. As for durability, it's made of a plasticky-flexible material, so it probably is pretty durable. You get what you pay for, and - in this case, that's OK.
customer_reviews.author: S. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: This fan doesnt suck, it BLOWS!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the same model fan thats on its way out. I've owned the other fan for years now and surprisingly, its the exact same build quality. I tested it side by side. Not a quiet fan, but perfect for those who need a bit of noise to accompany them to sleep. Id recommend getting the black color - this fan is a dust magnet.
customer_reviews.author: Rick A.

customer_reviews.title: A great fan for small areas
customer_reviews.text: This fan is my lifesaver for my bathroom! My bathroom has no air circulation at all and it’s hot when your in it fast. I was able to set this up above my door facing right at the toilet when your on it, or I can adjust the fan down and I feel it when I’m trying to do my face routine. It’s a good fan and easy to clean it with a duster, as it gets right in the cracks. It would be nice if it blew a little more stronger like the full size model, other that it’s worth your money.
customer_reviews.author: Alize V-D

customer_reviews.title: Nice fan for the bedroom or any room
customer_reviews.text: We were so uncomfortable in the hot evening at my dad’s mobile home. There was 1 smallish window and now airflow or breeze on the hot summer nights. I saw the reviews and thought I’d give this fan a try. What a world of difference it makes in out bedroom. We sleep comfortably on hot nights. I’ve used it in the living room and targeted the air flow towards us. It really make a big difference, especially when my 90 year old dad is cold and we are hot. I highly recommend for the price and value. Compact, won’t take up much space. Gets the job done. Great for small spaces
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Barrientos

customer_reviews.title: Saves on HEATING BILL - YES!!
customer_reviews.text: We have high ceilings and electric heat - a costly combination. This is because the heat rises and the cold settles. What to do? Obviously, the reverse is what you want - OR - mix the airs! ONE of these wonderful little fans, placed on the floor, aimed at the ceiling, totally homogenizes the air temperature in any room! It is AMAZING! Works even in large rooms with high ceilings. Besides that, this fan is quiet, durable, and takes up little space.
customer_reviews.author: napitalk

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely no way to clean it
customer_reviews.text: This is the third of this same fan that I’ve purchased. They are great little fans with lots of cooling and minimal noise. Why only 3 stars? These fans are absolutely uncleanable. The are not made to be broken down and cleaned at all. These fans build up tons of dust, dirt and debris, with nothing to be done about it. I have ended up throwing 2 away while still working because the filth level gets too high for me. Most fans are built to be able to be at least moderately dusted off and cleaned, but definitely not this one.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: These Fans are FANTASTIC!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this Honeywell fan for two years and it continues to do a great job for me. I actually have four Honeywell fans going right now and I'm extremely satisfied with their performance. I live on the island of Kauai in Hawaii in a studio apartment a few blocks from the beach. I love where I live, but we have no airconditioning and, starting in May and continuing through October, it is very hot in my place. Outside it is warm, but in a South facing apartment that does not get the tradewinds, you have to have fans and many of them. I highly recommend the Honeyweill fans to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Peggy C.

customer_reviews.title: Very upsetting!! Doesn’t blow good at all.
customer_reviews.text: Very upset with this fan. I got this fan knowing how well and strong the force of the fan usually is as I have another one that I bought from Walmart. Do I decided to get this one from here since there were none left at Walmart and I would receive it in 2 days. We have been using it in our small bedroom for about 3 days now and it does NOT have the same force that the one I got from Walmart does. Very disappointing! I want my money back or a replacement as this fan barely blows anything out.
customer_reviews.author: Colie

customer_reviews.title: quiet but powerful!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical before purchasing because we were looking for a fan to use in the bedroom at night. We have a baby monitor, and every other fan we have tried is so loud we can't hear the monitor at night. This fan was quiet enough on high to still hear the monitor loud and clear. We found that high was too cold though, so we left in on low, and it was perfect for a warm night. I rarely take the time to leave reviews (especially good ones), but this product was exactly what we needed and was high above our expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Roger C

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Fan!
customer_reviews.text: We love this fan. We have one in the bedroom and it does a great job of helping out the central air conditioning in the warm weather. even in the cooler weather. It is nice for the background sound...although it isn't very loud at all. I have to check in the morning to see if it is on. I ordered a second identical fan to help out in other areas of the house as needed. Great price. The first fan has been in use for a long time, so it is reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Grammy N.

customer_reviews.title: Great little fan!
customer_reviews.text: It’s only been a few days, but so far this fan is working perfectly. I have a ventilation issue in my master bathroom that is torture in the summertime, and this little fan has made it totally bearable to shower in there. It produces quite a bit of air for such a small fan, and it’s actually cold air! I’m very pleased. Even if it doesn’t hold up forever, especially with near constant use, it’s so inexpensive that I probably wouldn’t hesitate to replace it in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Megan T.

customer_reviews.title: Work Horse
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these since 2014. I use one mainly for white noise for sleeping, so I use this fan 8-10 hours a day, 365 days a year. I also use one in my office. Over time they do get louder and louder, but I think it's due to the amount of wear. After 5+ years one recently stopped working, and the other one is getting louder and I think it'll stop working soon too. Still, that's a great run for a $15 fan. I would/and am going to continue to order these.
customer_reviews.author: GracieLou731

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Small Size Fan For Minimal Spaces!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a mini fan for my small size bedroom. After I spent decent amount of time looking through many other fans reviews from Amazon, I finally found this little Honeywell branded HT-900 model with lots of positive reviews. So I decided to give it a try... Wow, I was so impressed with this mini fan because it kicks out much stronger winds than I expected! If you need a small fan for your minimal areas, I highly recommend this Honeywell fan.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Second one
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the first one for myself and was happy about how well it performed. I use it when I'm on my computer which is in a small space that tends to get hot even when the air conditioner is on. Now because of the China Virus my son that lives in Chicago has to work from home and has a similar circumstance so I ordered this one for him...He seems to be very happy with it. I wonder why Amazon would ask me to rate the "Warmth" It's a FAN!
customer_reviews.author: Richard S. Sberlati

customer_reviews.title: absolute garbage. Broken after 1 week of use
customer_reviews.text: absolute garbage. Broken after 1 week of use. i bought extra fuses becasue I thought that was the problem but no - just broken.
customer_reviews.author: reader

customer_reviews.title: CAN NOT REASSEMBLE AFTER CLEANING
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE THIS FAN IN A LARGER SIZE. I JUST FIGURED OUT HOW TO GAIN ACCESS FOR BLADE AND GRILL CLEANING. THERE ARE 5 RECESSED SCREWS ON THE BACK. I CLEANED IT AND BECAUSE THE HOLE FOR THE SCREWS ARE NOT CENTERED IN THE DARK RECESSED HOLES I CAN NOT PUT IT BACK TOGETHER. I RECOMMENED A DIFFERENT BRAND FOR THAT REASON ONLY. OTHER THIS SIZE IS GREAT FOR A 12 X 14 MAX ROOM SIZE. Sure could use help but live alone and housebound.
customer_reviews.author: MAGICARPET

customer_reviews.title: Smooth steady white noise of fan will go away in about 10 months...
customer_reviews.text: Used fan only at night for white noise for about 6 hours per night. Fan worked well for about 10 months and then it starts making odd sounds, varying rattling type sounds which defeats the purpose of a nice steady fan type white noise. This has happened twice back to back, will not order anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonman

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT assume fan actually has any "turbo" at all since it in the name!!!
customer_reviews.text: This fans really sucks and DOES NOT blow anything close to TURBO. I wanted high power fan and all I got was high power name. Talk about false advertising. It stated that fan could be felt 25 feet away, more like 25 inches. If fan not literally "in your face" you won't feel a thing and it has to be on high for that to happen. They should be ashamed to claim 3 speeds, when all settings are practically "all no blow". The low & medium settings were a joke, at best and should have been eliminated in order to boost one speed closer to "turbo" instead of wasting plastic and our time with a misleading speed setting at all!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan ACADguru

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this small fan to use on hot summer days to help circulate the air and after three or four uses (for short periods of time) the fan no longer works. While shopping for a fan I did read other users had the same problem, but I thought Honeywell is a well known brand and maybe they just received a bad one, so I gave it a shot. Well, I also have the same problem. I contacted Honeywell and they advised me to contact Kaz. We will see what happens. Lesson: just spend a little more and get a better quality fan.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Underrated! Good speed, noise and size
customer_reviews.text: I have had this fan running since I got for about 2 weeks straight (varying speeds). Very much enjoying it, the noise is what I'd expect and while Coworkers can sometimes hear it typically it does not get in the way. Size is good easy to maneuver and pivot to reach around. My only complaint, more of feedback is that the top, middle, and low speed feel close in how much air they provide. Would have liked an even slower setting.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Damato

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fan!
customer_reviews.text: It is an amazing fan! I've had it for a few months and it still works great. I use it almost daily at my desk because my room gets hot often. It has a very nice switch and great 0-3 levels of power. I usually use 1 but I like having the option to go up to 2 or even 3 if I am really hot. It does get a little bit loud when at max, but as I said, I usually use it at level 1 because it is sufficient. It does take about a minute to ramp up and get to full speed, but other than that, it is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amir

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these which I have been using for years. This is going sound really bad. One fan is in a dirty location and is dirty. Rather than clean it like a normal person I'm buying a new one. I should probably clean the room also. Anyway the fans are never turned off and have worked for years. If they ever go bad or get to dirty I'll just replace them with the same model. Note the other fans are completely clean because I actually vacuum and clean the rooms they are in. So I'm not completely gross.
customer_reviews.author: BaronTop Contributor: Batman

customer_reviews.title: Quieter and lower fair flow than older versions, but that is what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this for where I wanted to use this. I am using this on a desk a few feet away and for this it is perfect, just the right amount of air and quiet. I agree with other reviewers that this does not seem to blow as hard as the older models. The older one one the lowest setting was as strong as this one is on the highest setting and it is much louder. So if you want something that is small, quiet and not going to knock you over this works very well and is good quality.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Office Fan
customer_reviews.text: Like many, I've been working from home these last few months and running my AC on-stop. I needed a smaller fan for my office and was pleased to find this one. It's perfect for sitting on a desk, table, or even on the floor. Plus it is lightweight and easy to transport so I can take it to other rooms in the house. I love having my doors and windows open during the cooler weather in Arizona and this fan will help those days feel more comfortable in my office.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly solid fan for the money
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much from this thing, as late last summer, I simply purchased the cheapest thing available to escape the heat in a college apartment which does not have a thermostat in each unit. To my surprise, it actually delivered. This thing can produce a pretty powerful gust that's more than adequate for one person and with moderate noise (quieter than the archetypal rotating floor fan you grew up with, but also not particularly quiet). At the two lowest settings, the breeze is comfortable at a short distance, and the noise is pretty low and generally not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ashby Gray

customer_reviews.title: Good air circulator
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace an older Honeywell column fan. Initially, I was not pleased with it's power. I thought it should have been more powerful. But having used it for a month or so, I've come to love it. It's small, and I can easily transport from room to room. Comes apart for cleaning and maintenance. You can run it for hours. And it's good next to your bed, or in your office, or just to keep a room cool.
customer_reviews.author: P. Clark

customer_reviews.title: The answer my friend is blowing in the wind
customer_reviews.text: I use this fan in a window with the idea that I do not have an exhaust fan in my bathroom. Thus this works perfectly to project the humidity (steam) outside. Upon initially opening the box (to appease my curiosity) I checked out the different levels of air current (for a lack of a better way to phrase it) by putting aiming it at my face. Its highest velocity is Stronger than I expected. The lowest is fairly low. Yet Stronger than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: A. Silber

customer_reviews.title: Good fan for the price, but they do break quite often.
customer_reviews.text: I use to buy these fans for the house as they work great..for about a year. Then they always die after about one year. You can pretty much be guaranteed that you'll be chucking these in the landfill after a year. I buy Vornado fans now, they are about 3.5 the cost for a comparable fan (when not on sale), but are guaranteed for 5 years and I've never had one die on me yet. If you need the fan for a long time, it's cheaper to buy a Vornado.
customer_reviews.author: sirpeternincompoop

customer_reviews.title: Honeywell
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan in 2018 for the hot summer nights, and let me just say this fan does not disappoint! But it did recently stop working it started to make scraping noise then just stopped working all together but keep in mind Ive had it for almost three years, and I used it at the highest speed everyday. Dust wasn't a problem until not but I simply just took a pipe cleaner and a duster and cleaned it. It blew a cool breeze until its last one. lol. money well spent but sadly I did not purchase another Honeywell, but I will update this review when I get my new fan for a comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle

customer_reviews.title: Cool Air And Low Noise
customer_reviews.text: This baby gets the job done in my 10 by 10 guest bedroom. I can't even sleep with it on 3 because it gets too cold. I keep it on 2. This is the 1st week. I will update this if anything changes. The noise level is about 3 out 10 and it helps me sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Ebony

customer_reviews.title: Add Honeywell to the list of brands no longer producing quality products
customer_reviews.text: Replaced same size same brand fan with this and I’m not happy. It may be quieter sure but it’s not because of great engineering it’s because the motor is 1/3 less powerful than the old one. The high setting is now like the low setting on the old one.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite tabletop fans.
customer_reviews.text: This is or 3rd time buying these fans over the last 5 years. We use them on our nightstands and they work great! Noise is acceptable but not perfect, and wind output is outstanding for a fan this size. I feel we get a great amount of use from them. That said, I wish they would last a bit longer. Like clockwork, the motors seem to burn out at the 2 year mark (heavy-ish use, routinely cleaned.) This is my only complaint about these fans. Otherwise they suit us perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Big T

customer_reviews.title: Sporadic functionality and finally just died
customer_reviews.text: Bought this about a year ago. At first, ran fine. Quiet and got the job done. However, as time moved on it began to run at different speeds all on its own. Sometimes it would not run at all until you gave it a little shake and then it would start up. Finally, this week it just stopped. No amount of coaxing, jostling, shaking, pleading, begging, threatening, or cursing would get it to work. Into the trash. :-(
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Schryver

customer_reviews.title: I Purchased two of these and they have been running 24 x 7 for over a year.
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased two of these and they have been running 24 x 7 for over a year to circulate basement air. I keep two of these in my basement just to keep the air circulating, in addition to a dehumidifier. They’ve both been running constantly for nearly a year. The only time I’ve turned them off is to brush the dust out of the fan cover. Excellent price and they’ve done me very well.
customer_reviews.author: Deborahonthebeach

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for sleeping!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little fan for bedroom! Since I had my third child and got my tubes tied, I get so hot when I sleep. I have a ceiling fan and it just wasn’t cutting it because I like to be bundled up but not sweating my socks off! So I put this fan on my dresser and it is perfect! Not loud but loud enough to drown out the tv in my kids room which always bugged me. It’s great for that bit of white noise perfect for sleeping and does a great job keeping me cool!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Boudreaux

customer_reviews.title: Perfect office fan to achieve that blowy hair look
customer_reviews.text: I tend to run hot and work in a shared office with a heater which is either ON or OFF, making the office often hotter than I'd like. This fan is the perfect compensation. It's the perfect size to place on my desk and blow at my face to help me feel just enough cooler. Plus, you get that movie-star blowing hair look! Bought it here on Amazon 2 years ago and have used it pretty much every workday since, still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Sapere Aude

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price but don’t last long
customer_reviews.text: Cheap but get what you pay for. Had a white one last a year but quickly started with squealing noises like the internal bearing was screwed up and intermittent motor failure. The second one I got in black after about a year it started with the intermittent squealing, intermittent motor failure, after about 2 1/4 years it finally just stopped turning back on. However for the price I don’t regret the buy and I do leave it running 24 seven to circulate room air. Debating on getting a third one actually so it’s so much cheaper than the competitors.
customer_reviews.author: Girl

customer_reviews.title: Crack face grill coverl.
customer_reviews.text: Just receive the fan & upon unboxing it i notice theres a small crack on the front cover . Would this be a problem or would tge crack get bigger everytime i take out the front grill for cleaning & washing. Just letting you know. The fan is super quite & very handy convenient ,just tge right size to place anywhere you want it for air circulation.please see the pictures i’ll be waiting for amazon response to this!!!!
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Circulation
customer_reviews.text: I really like this fan. I don't think that this fan can be a desk fan. I feel that this is too large to be a desk fan but it's great when company is around, it circulates the whole room. Its small enough to not really be noticed. Also, the movement of the fan is great. The three speeds are perfect for me and it really does reach a good distance. Overall, highly recommended! Great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Nice fan, compact size. Fast shipping !!
customer_reviews.text: When I got the fan out of the box and plugged it in, it made a rubbing sound that was distracting. I was able to take it apart and adjust a few blades. Runs quiet now !! Nice speeds, and size. Perfect for traveling or setting up in the bedroom during those hot summer evenings.
customer_reviews.author: gr8ful57

customer_reviews.title: Small and powerfull
customer_reviews.text: This small fan does more than many big ones! I have two in the bedroom (one at each nightstand) and it cools us down even at hot summer days. Together they do a much better job than our previous tower fan. Plus this is a great price! Beware they are a bit noisy, if you are very sensitive this could be a problem. I can sleep fine and my husband (who has problems with noise, for example he hates the AC noise) is also enjoying it fine.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 75 days
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these two years ago and it performed flawlessly for roughly 5,000 hours. Replaced it due to it starting to sound a bit noisy with a second one on July 2nd. It’s now mid-September and the new fan failed - not sure if it’s a blown fuse or something else. For warranty service I’d have to pay to send it in and include $10 for return shipping- not worth it for a $12 fan. Evidently it’s hit or miss on these - great success with the first but disappointed in the second.
customer_reviews.author: Super Dave

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, Reliable Office Fan
customer_reviews.text: I'm a cubicle monkey in Florida. I can't stand working without a fan blowing on me especially because I'm hunched over drawing with a stylus on a large glass Wacom Centiq tablet with a fingerless cotton glove, trying not to sweat. These are quiet, reliable fans. They last perhaps three years of full time use before the bearings give out. I haven't found any other affordable fans to be as useful. These are just right for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Florida PhD

customer_reviews.title: Barely moves the air
customer_reviews.text: There is very little difference between low and medium; which is super low, and High is more like most fans on medium or even low. The knob is hard to reach but that might be due to location I have it on bedside table that is taller than bed. Knob is midway up on the back of fan. I sit up and turn the fan around to reach the knob. I would rather have a different fan, but will not hassle with returning it. We had 5 days of 100+ degrees in a row now, so anything helps.
customer_reviews.author: Sundown

customer_reviews.title: Very nice little fan.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good size fan to have next to the bed to help me sleep at night. It makes a small amount of noise that's comforting but not so much that you have to turn the tv up. Worked really well for what I wanted. One note, the box claimed you would be able to feel it 20 feet away. Absolutely not true. This is not one of those wind tunnel type fans. The breeze is decent but not overwhelming. I don't think it helps move air around the room, but it's great when you want a fan at close range.
customer_reviews.author: GeneQueen09

customer_reviews.title: Not so quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Good price, but it is not too quiet as description. If you are looking for a quiet fan, you should buy tower fan. Even a ceiling fan is quieter than this one. There are three speeds, but the slowest speed is also very windy. The middle level is needless, it is similar to the lowest level. It should makes a slower speed and cancel the middle level of the wind speed, then it can quieter. Why I gave 2 stars isn’t 3, because the fan base is too sharp, and my wallpaper is punctured.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Will not stay in position
customer_reviews.text: Overall the fan is decent not quite a lot of air being pushed out and the form factor it’s a nice size fan the only drawback is the positioning locks are too far apart and will not stay in between it’s either straight out or 45° up no in between setting, the noise level on the fan is moderate it’s not overpowering but it’s not quite for the price I guess it’s a decent fan using it as a back up.
customer_reviews.author: Lwood

customer_reviews.title: It’s fine
customer_reviews.text: So I buy fans for white noise and I prefer a noisy fan. This fan is ok for that but I wish it was a little louder. On low and med speeds it’s very quiet. High is food enough for me to use to sleep so I’d buy again. However I don’t expect the fan to last for more than a year. It seems a little cheaply made but it could prove me wrong. Overall I’m fine with it, but not the best fan I’ve owned.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: This fan works as per product description
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a simple fan for both white noise and cooling. I place the fan next to the shared-wall in my apartment where it does a good job cancelling out neighbor noises. I prefer the lowest setting for the quieter steady sound and sufficient air flow. This fan is lightweight with a convenient handle making it easy to move or reposition. It also has up & down snap-in-place adjustable angles so you can aim-control the air flow direction. I liked the fan well enough that I bought a 2nd one and am crossing my fingers that these will last for a reasonable amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Cynanne G.

customer_reviews.title: Just Doesn't Last
customer_reviews.text: We are the type of people that sleep with a fan blowing all night. I have purchased 4 or 5 of these over the past few years because they were inexpensive and I couldn't bring myself to buy a $50 fan. However, I am changing my mind because these fans only last 6-12 months. It gets to the point where it won't start, and to get the fan going I have to use a small object to get the blades spinning before it will engage and move by itself. I won't be buying these again, but will be going for something that can last longer.
customer_reviews.author: A-Salis

customer_reviews.title: Space saving, high power fan. It the best purchased I ever make for a fan
customer_reviews.text: I like that this little fan can push air with just 1 power level but however is a little loud at level 3. There is some improvement that it can make like an higher quality motor that make less sound with higher air blow at power level 3. I bought two and I try to reorder again for every room and person that sleeping my house. It done a great job keeping body cool at night.
customer_reviews.author: YuongHuao

product_meta.title: Honeywell HT-900 TurboForce Air Circulator Fan Black,Small
product_meta.description: The 3 speed Honeywell HT 900 TurboForce Air Circular provides a quiet and efficient means of cooling a surrounding area. The HT 900 is 25 percent quieter than its competitors and represents a superior selection for those seeking a relatively noiseless experience when it comes to emitting large amounts of cool air. An adjustable fan head is fully capable of pivoting and reaching a 90° angle that can be used for direct cooling or circulating the air. Maximum air distribution is achieved via the inclusion of an Aerodynamic Turbo Design. This fan's small size and efficient output opens a wealth of installation options in the home, office or dorm setting. The availability of three selectable speeds carries the added bonus of potentially reducing energy expenses. The TurboForce Air Circulator Fan can be used for personal or powerful directional cooling.
feature_bullets: Small fan for table or floor:The Honeywell turbo force air circulator fan has 3 speeds & a 90 degree pivoting head. This quiet fan is compact enough for on a table or wall mount & powerful enough to help provide comfortable cooling in small-medium rooms.

Feel the Power: Honeywell's TurboForce line of fans have an aerodynamic turbo design to maximize air movement, offering the power for intense cooling or energy-saving air circulation. The ease of a small fan with power you can feel from 27 feet away

Increase your comfort: Using fans for air circulation in your home can help Increase your comfort, and help reduce energy costs as well. Honeywell carries a range of tower fans, floor fans, and oscillating fans -- find one for every room in the house.

Honeywell fans: The right fan helps cool you off & improves airflow in your room or home. Give your air conditioner & wallet a break by using fans to help reduce your energy consumption & costs. Honeywell carries a variety of fans to meet your home needs.
Honeywell quality: Help Improve Air Circulation & Energy Savings in Your Home, Bedroom or Office With Honeywell Fans.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars38,592 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Honeywell HT-900 TurboForce Air Circulator Fan Black
